sentences.en: At length she gained the end of the ascent and stood upon the turret top.
sentences.cn: 最后她到达了梯子尽头,站在塔顶上面了.

sentences.en: Burke pushed the button and the elevator began its slow ascent.
sentences.cn: 伯克按动电钮;电梯开始缓慢上升.

sentences.en: He called back as he began his ascent.
sentences.cn: 他一边往上爬,一边回头说.

sentences.en: His own career continues its inexorable ascent.
sentences.cn: 他事业的上升势头锐不可当。

sentences.en: Hot and perspiring, he toiled up the dusty ascent.
sentences.cn: 他艰难地在尘土飞扬的坡道上爬着,热得汗水淋淋.

sentences.en: In 1955 he led the first ascent of Kangchenjunga, the world's third highest mountain.
sentences.cn: 他于1955年带队首攀世界第三高峰——干城章嘉峰。

sentences.en: In the ascent every wing beat becomes an exhausting struggle.
sentences.cn: 在爬升的过程中,每一次拍打翅膀都是一次筋疲力尽的痛苦挣扎.

sentences.en: It was a tough course over a gradual ascent before the big climb of Bluebell Hill.
sentences.cn: 在爬崎岖的蓝钟山之前有一段很难走的上行缓坡路。

sentences.en: It would be wrong to portray his life as a calculated ascent to power at any cost.
sentences.cn: 如果把他的一生描述成不惜任何代价一心想向上爬，那就错了。

sentences.en: The climbers roped up and began the ascent of the cliff face.
sentences.cn: 登山队员们系上绳子串连起来,开始攀登峭壁.

sentences.en: The final ascent took only half an hour.
sentences.cn: 最后那次登山只花了半小时.

sentences.en: the first ascent of Mount Everest
The first part of the ascent is not steep.
sentences.cn: 开始一段上坡路并不陡峭.

sentences.en: The old man had difficulty climbing the rapid ascent.
sentences.cn: 这位老人攀登这条陡峭的上坡路有困难.

sentences.en: They made a successful ascent of the mountain.

words.tran_cn: 上升的人或物；字母的上半（或下半）出头部分

trans.tran_en: the act of climbing something or moving upwards
